conbody.p: For an outgoing connection, the Bluetooth stack will not, by default, enforce any particular Bluetooth security. If the remote device requires authentication/encryption to connect, then this will be handled by the stack transparently to the application.

section.title: How to use security on outgoing sockets
section.p: It may occasionally be necessary for the local application to insist on authenticating or encrypting the link. In this case, there are control operations (ioctls) that can be issued on a connected RSocket that will authenticate (ioctl KHCIAuthRequestIoctl) or encrypt (KHCIEncryptIoctl) the link.
